Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Dude, I'm not sure if it was you that I watched in telegram, but if it was: You came into the channel that is full of people playing on herosphere and claimed nobody was playing on herosphere. I would have banned you right there if I was an admin. Instead they asked you to provide proof. You only posted a link to a page with like 30 contests, each having between 3 and 15 players joined and continued claiming bullshit stuff. I mean, yeah, you are right, KuCoin volume is largely fake - as for any other coin that I hold. Surprise! But that's rarely the teams fault, what should they do about it? And in all my time in the herocoin channel they have RARELY ever banned one. And in your case (if that was you) people actually applauded the admins for banning you. And so do I. Calm your tits man, you are making a total fool of yourself.  Edit: Also your ST claim is bullshit. Are you even sure you are in the right thread?!

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Yea I would just like to see this whole thing take off, I know it certainly could given a chance.    Vital thing is to get enough users into games.    So anything I mention is with that hope basically, I've been betting esports for many years now and I could use this one for sure.   So yea I think being able to place a bet and just ponder over the choices made should be allowed before being fixed into it.    The terms are familiar to any regular but new people are going to need a minute to comprehend the choice vs the rules,  maybe look at that FAQ and get a sense for what is required to get 'the win' in this contest     This part which pops up is opposite to that, pay first and then decide.   I know people could in theory get out pencil and paper and figure it that way maybe but I think people literally are going to weigh it up on screen 90% of the time, discuss with others possibly, screencap, link.  Also include mobile users who just are doing it on the go.  Also another factor is payout or if the contest never proceeds, the buy-in is returned.    But if the pay is not there for a week or its tied up, it slows down users who might otherwise enter the next game.   Especially those new players who are just turning over the free buy-in and getting into the site.   Hopefully Im understood, its the iteration of the bets made that counts alot.   I think this is common to every gamble site even if this site is unique, its the turnover of bets and players so the payout on the last game feeds into the next bet and so on.   I think that'd be a larger part of encouraging an accumulation of betting.     https://www.herosphere.gg/counter-strike-global-offensive/2019-iem-season-xiii-katowice-world-championship-champions-stage-bracket-bracket-final-1000-45-x-2  Anyway today is the CSGO grand final, quite an upset possible.  Newcomer vs dominant team, some will be certain in their bets but others loyal to the newcomers.    Thats the link for it, anyone spotted a voucher code that I havent.   I used one but the contest never went ahead so that play is tied up

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Hey, I am not sure If I understood everything but  concerning buy ins: u always have the possibility to change your choice of team or the match result - as long as the contest didn't start obviously. In my opinion it doesn't matter If you buy in first or If you confirm your buy in as soon as you are satisfied with your choice. However, If the community would prefer a "later" buy in it will be discussed within the team (Not speaking for the technical part, needs to be clarified If it is possible)  Second point is about pay-outs We are aware that it needs too long at the moment in many cases and this is on top of our priority list. We already talked with our data provider and we see a good progress here. This situations should become way better soon, hopefully.  Concerning your Voucher question: vouchers are disabled at the moment due to technical reasons. Should be live again very soon Sorry for the inconvenience.

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Thanks for that feedback, we will try to improve the experience in the future. Right now in our contest everyone can find an info tab, where all the contest rules are explained, I will copy it here for everyone who is reading only on the thread:  Contest Rules The contest will only start if at least 3 participants have joined. Otherwise your buy-in will be refunded.  Fantasy Rules In the fantasy section you need to select your 3 favourite players. You collect points for the leaderboard, depending on the performance of these players within the matches of this contest.  Kill: +2 points Assist: +1 point Death: -1 point First Blood: +3 points Assist First Blood: +2 points Selected player not playing: +25 points  Match Rules You can collect points for each match in this contest. If you predict the correct result, you will get the most points, but even the correct tendency will bring you points for the leaderboard. When you missed to place your bets or your prediction was wrong, you do not get any points.  You can get 21 points for perfect predictions. Predictions with the correct winner tendency is rewarded with 15 points.  Ranking (Tiebreaker) Tiebreaker rules for the ranking are 1. count of perfect predictions 2. count of submitted predictions 3. contest join date 4. user registration date  Payout Top 45% of the ranking will double the buy-in   I sincerely hope this helps!

Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Thank you very much for your kind words. We are going to do our best to make HEROcoin an outstanding project. Unfortunately we made a mistake in this picture: the real timeframe is 2017-2018. (we updated the post) Sorry for that. But maybe this is showing that we are visionaries and live in the future.

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Hi Estell,  if I get you right, you would like to have a short summary about HEROcoin.io and herosphere.gg?    We are HERO, the issuer of the cryptocurrency HEROcoin (Ticker: $PLAY). Our ICO took place from September 2017 - October 2017 (unfortunately these dates were wrong in the graphics above; we updated the post). In the last year we managed to relaunch our first use case, which was free to play and had almost 250.000 users. herosphere.gg Now, one year after the ICO ended, we are close to mainnet (on the Ethereum Blockchain).  herosphere.gg is an esports prediction platform, which allows you to bet on esports events (we also provide fantasy esports on the platform). This is our own use case, but HEROcoin can be used by any other betting provider. Therefor in the future it might be possible to bet on Tennis, Football, Formula 1, ... and of course esports with HEROcoin.  I hope that helps you.   If you have more questions or would like to get more details please join our Telegram channel (https://t.me/herocoinio) to discuss topics with the HERO team and the community.  All the best

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: 🎮💰5000$ LoL Worlds Contest on herosphere.gg + FREE First Bet!💰  Hey HEROES!  HEROcoin launched it´s first mainnet contest our esports platform herosphere.gg today! Perfect timing as the first contest will be the League of Legends Worlds Finals 2018!  5000$ in PLAY - Granted Prize Pool!   As a launch special we are giving an additional granted prize pool of 5000$ in PLAY!   This one is available for participants who join the 5.000 PLAY and the 20.000 PLAY contest.   In addition to the winnings of the general pot we will reward the winner of our 5.000 PLAY buy-in contest with 175.000 PLAY, the winner of our 20.000 PLY buy-in contest with  + 265.000 PLAY - on top.  ANOTHER SURPRISE: 10$ FREE BET  Yes, it gets even better! We are providing a FREE 1000 PLAY BET worth over 10$ for the first 50 players to register.  You can use this one for a contest of your choice and yes, it's enough to buy in completely in one contest!  In order to receive your FREE 1000 PLAY you only need to:  1) SIGN UP HERE: http://herosphe.re/btctalkspecial  2) Post your herosphere USERNAME and PLAYwallet address down below (only onplatform wallets are eligible, we will check it)  How to get your PLAYwallet address?   After you signed up on herosphere.gg you can create your wallet here:   After identity information & creating your password you receive your PLAYwallet address. Comment it down below with your herosphere.gg username and we will transfer you the 1000PLAY. !Important: We don´t pay for the first transaction cost after that we will cover all transaction costs, so you need to transfer only 0,01ETH. Everything else, we got you covered!   We worked very hard to create this new blockchain product and we highly appreciate every single one of you participating!  Brand new product and not much competition yet! Good luck everybody!

Body: Hey,  that depends on how the current beta wave is running. For now, I can tell you that we are very satisfied with the outcome of the wave 3 tests and we got again some very important and helpful input from our beta tester. If everything goes on like this we will start wave 4 of closed beta and switch to mainnet within this month. If everything runs smooth on our closed mainnet tests (and we are pretty confident) we will start with open beta.  There will also be a last signup period for wave 4 so stay tuned.  Since we are aiming to deliver a 100% reliable and secure blockchain product, we can't give any specific release dates (in case we find unexpected issues). But we are close to finish  . We hope for your understanding and thanks for the ongoing support! Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: I think they are doing both, it'll be possible for people to use the token directly but also the herosphere site is like a more traditional setup with set odds for games.  Its probably a good idea to do both initially but of the two the former has the bigger potential especially internationally possibly.    House odds are often ending up indirectly related to betting by the majority anyhow.  I've done 'lay away' type betting on mainstream sports also, I understand the interest is not small in that either    Ive been on sites where the bet started off blank all open and the odds swung wildly as bets of various sizes came in, that setup led to a 'sniping' kind of relationship where the biggest bets swung in the last closing seconds.  It made for some interesting games, I got over 40x return on one surprising game someone big had too much confidence in the overdogs team of just a short game and my team had a few rough diamonds (unknown talent) on there who came through for me, fun bet House odds are good for encouraging regular usage though

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Hi James, hi Tolka,  thank you very much for your messages.  To clarify this issue:  The KYC process has nothing to do with HEROcoin ($PLAY), but every use case (like our herosphere.gg) has to have a KYC process. This means if you  use herosphere.gg you have to take part in this process. When HEROcoin ($PLAY) is used by a third party provider, there should be a KYC process too. But this depends (as we wrote on Medium) on every use case provider. If you bought HEROcoin ($PLAY) in our ICO, you already took part in our KYC process regarding the ICO.  I hope that makes everything clear for you.  If you have anymore questions please feel free to ask us anytime.

Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: I thought similar but the internets a big place and I dont think it could be expected one company controls all usage of Ethereum even when its a particular token.    I guess there are systems like XRP where its all centrally controlled on puppet strings and they could be expected to have in their grasp everyones personal usage but from what I've read that wont be the case here.    If I wanted to pay the milkman with some PLAY token then thats my business affair and responsibility, I really dont want anyone messing with that idea personally.    This is part of why China has been so against crypto though its a complicated country they dont generally dont like or respect free exchange..     I've offered in the past  if anyone wants to trade my digital goods, a steam account for some PLAY they can contact me as I'm happy to hold PLAY vs reasonable prospects.  Thats obviously just my personal take but generally price is a poor indicator by itself, its obvious the wider dynamics to ETH is effecting this project like a rip tide

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Prices reflect the overall bearishness of alt coins vs BTC dominance, theres a % figure listed somewhere for how much bias does the market place towards BTC.  I was thinking it'd be good to graph the rate of change on that as a gauge to alt trends.    Since BTC fixed their fee situation and because we retract in price it has people thinking to just stay with that first and foremost blockchain.   But thats the sheep dynamic, it doesn't determine success and price is just a factor.   The point of this particular token is to do more then just be a speculative ticket, I dont exactly agree on viewing or describing in that way.    Its the tide going out but I think this is one thing that has legs of its own to move somewhere, which will be important long term  My general intention is just keep buying here and there some more PLAY Rather then trade out at this depressed price, if anyone is wanting to exchange some of their PLAY for my steam account with PubG and CSGO on there along with a dozen other games I'd be happy to do that just let me know by pm.  I think digital goods are most relevant to crypto and the general premise for this project was in the right place, so I'm just waiting to see if my bet was right :p

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Hi Fox,  Closed beta | release: We have scheduled at least three waves in our closed beta to have enough feedback from the community. We are currently in die middle of wave two. If everything works fine, we might already be on main net with wave three.  After the closed beta we are heading directly to the open beta.  Exchanges: At the moment we are listed on a major exchange (Kucoin). Other exchange are on our list but currently we are focusing on the product development. We believe that the product (our first use case www.herosphere.gg) is the key for our longterm success. After the release of our open beta we will work on new possibilities regarding exchanges.  If you need more information or would like to discuss HERO related issues, you should join our Telegram channel: https://t.me/herocoinio  Thank you very much for your support.

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: The main thing for this project is the revenue and cyclical trade, the speculation on the token price is really secondary to that and not necessarily reflective of ongoing prospects.  Most of us realise the Bitcoin influence despite being a completely separate blockchain, its largely influential in perception of success or popularity overall.   The story for HEROcoin probably I hope goes alot deeper and its about whether it will be used or not, if it does go ahead anyone longterm who follows esports games knows this can be massive.    Theres zero wrong with esports as a growth story and really at least 10% of the price should reflect that prospect instead we're tied to deflation/inflation of the overall crypto user base and exchange pricing which is mostly speculative and some inverse to Dollar index strength even.   The actual story for HEROcoin itself taking over as a narrative I'm looking forward to, I would not advise anyone to feel at all downcast in shorterm by a simple number which is a guess of ongoing value.

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: The contents are more important then the label, the price is just a speculation on current factors and this PLAY token is not actively being used.   Presuming it proceeds with the proposed system of revenue it should prove alot more worth then the face value its only held as at present.    This is often a feature of markets, its what participants are being paid for when they hold.   I'm glad there are active businesses developing in the sector operating after ICO, I'd hate if the critics were justified in only believing negatives of crypto.  Actual utility across crypto is very bullish, people get lost just staring at prices  I think.   esports markets is much bigger then just this one factor and the exchanges it trades on, its a whole ecosphere separate from crypto but hopefully this will help connect and transmit it better.  Also good to see the company has changed the thread title this time to inform participants.  Previously I was denied tokens owed as a deadline was introduced to fulfil payments to ICO campaign participants, terms changed without various threads being updated properly such as the thread title or OP.   That mistake has been left behind but hopefully not forgotten and its good to see better information on this latest update   I'm not sure if there is a HEROcoin thread in the gambling section.   Perhaps this will be a thing after it becomes active

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Anyone who didnt receive the bounty after the close of the campaign due to T&C being changed can add their details to a thread I started here :  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2892870.msg29743762#msg29743762  The more people who can add themselves to the list as being owed PLAY tokens the more likely we can do something about it.   I also intend to start a petition to collect signatures on proper operation of KYC regulations.  Avoidance of exploitation or protfiteering should be standard practise across the crypto industry.  There is a good arguable case the KYC deadline unfairly benefited some over others, so far that case has not been defended only ignored.  In this particular case the participants across the crypto community not just Facebook and Twitter (who are now turning their back on ICO) were not sufficiently informed after the fact of the changes to payments: The thread title was altered for the close of the ICO but not the new KYC requirements. Spreadsheet with address details of participants were left unaltered with new requirements The opening post never reflected changes to T&C or new requirements for payment The campaign manager gave no mention of new requirements for payment when in correspondence with participants and/or was not made aware himself  I hope PLAY is successful overall and I said long before I was on the bounty campaign there is a good basis for the business but for a communication mixup to occur combined with a previously unannounced short deadline and then to ignore people trying to correct what was an obvious mistake is a misstep.   Quote from: trannguyen.22021999 on May 17, 2018, 04:20:45 AM Hello team i suggest that the PLAY tokens be added to the decentralized exchanges such as for example COSS there are now a lot of such exchanges and I think that such exchanges do not have to pay a lot of money so that the project tokens traded on these exchanges.Thank you  https://shapeshift.io/#/inputs/2  Could be good especially in the future where people win bets in PLAY.   Some of these bets will be 10% vs 90% odds or quite large winnings for unexpected or underdog wins.  10x leverage of the original amounts and I imagine the winners would use such an exchange if it were convenient

Author: g4force
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Why is Hero the best esports betting platform? What is going to make it better than Unikoin Gold for example, given that Unikoin is on more exchanges and has a higher marketcap and more volume. Any new exchanges coming in future?  Disclaimer: I do have Hero tokens but not Unikoin Gold

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Hey,  Being listed on more exchanges isn't that huge advantage as everyone think. The higher marketcap is a result of the way higher ICO price of Unikoin. Additionally, their total supply is 4x higher than HERO's so the price per token could drop drastically if they decide to put all their tokens on the market. In terms of volume I see 2 major reasons: First, more exchanges (yes, in that case, it is positive but it doesn't necessarily lead to a higher price) and secondly it is better known at the moment because of Ashton Kutcher and Mark Cuban.  What makes HERO better than Unikoin? HERO aims to remove the middleman and want to keep the money/tokens with the users. At Unikoin you bet against the house and users will loose money. Additionally HERO is open for every 3rd party provider who wants to implement the system and aims to create a whole online betting ecosphere with their system. Unikoin is closed and limited to their own platform.  For the near future, the focus is on developing the product so we will most likely not see any new exchanges at the moment.  I hope I could answer your questions properly,

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: We have internal some deadlines but we do not make it public for several reasons. If we have public deadlines the pressure to release something at a specific time before it is done properly is too high. We prefer to go live with a certain feature as soon as it is working as intended.

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: A market goes up and down regularly so its just a normal market currently.   It cant only be called good when the sun shines, generally I'm glad BTC solved some of its fees problem.   Thats a long term positive effect probably, price is something else   The PLAY tokens are a hold in the long term and in the short term its speculative what the price could be. Most of the time BTC sets the tone for alot of the alt market, thats fair enough as PLAY isnt in active usage so its seeing just speculative price movements.   Depends what you are intending to do, make a quick buck or hold long term.  I was just looking at BTC price and a recent high was the 200 Daily moving average which is also decent resistance on a number of perspectives for the moment.   Normally I'd expect even if bullish the price has to gain some momentum to jump that wall before it can continue rising, I expect it to hold resistance for now.   Some might prefer to return when there is a regular 'stair step' type gain in BTC price and alts generally.     If BTC sets the tide for crypto in some way, PLAY would be generally sideways ?  Thats my guess, my idea is to be buying on lows buts thats a long term idea.    Weak hands sell, a good market will allow the longer term holders to gain some benefit from accumulating.   A one sided market is actually bad, hence prices are cheaper for buyers is still positive.  tl;dr  The 200 day BTC price is rising still, in broad terms the crypto market isnt negative or impaired.  A cheaper price isnt a negative by itself

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Ironic thing is the token has a greater use then alot of crypto exchanged because it has a proposal for usage, active development is always something I look for.   You can still exchange for value even while that might be a speculative price but thats a description of alot of crypto and blockchains out there Im fairly sure.   So I'd place PLAY above alot of other value exchanged.   The thing to follow is the general prospects, the market sector being addressed (esports growth etc.) and that is a determination of value that is at least equal to an exchange price.   It wont have a fixed label like your bid/offer figure but ultimately the wider market is what gives the price.      Its a case of the tail wagging the dog if you get what I mean, the bid/offer is not what determines value utlimately.   Largely thats a reflection of sentiment right now and you have the backdrop of BTC which is massive but not a determination of actual prospects for usage of PLAY.   I'm fairly certain of this because it happens in the general money markets, if this were a game it would be lemmings   I dont just follow others personally

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Part of the overall weakness to crypto price.   Its normal kind of tide change that occurs, anyone long term in crypto isnt seeing anything new here.     I put in orders around this price so its all according to what I had expected as possible.      The majority of anything I hold longer term in crypto is what yields a dividend or return of some kind.   That is pretty much the point to holding this token so this is the time to read through or think through if you see the overall sector and scheme to be feasible and use the weakness for a positive.    Of course crypto is definitely not for the faint hearted but the price doesnt have to be a negative just because its in red.   This is just my general thinking, I hold yielding assets elsewhere in crypto and its always about the ongoing utility if its worth buying or not. Quote from: Bigger By The Day on March 18, 2018, 09:27:19 AM deal today  3 cents  only  for herocoin like ethos same price  and they hit 10 $ in december   Pretty much as cheap as its ever been but not as low in BTC terms https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/herocoin/

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: They introduced KYC after the ICO and bounty had closed.   That was the reasoning given for not paying people who were due tokens.  There was a period of 14 days to find out and pass KYC.  Here is why they should be paying people for publicity like they promised they would : https://www.btcnn.com/google-informally-banning-ico-ads/ Actually involving the community properly, not altering rules after close with only 14 days given would be best.   Every other company who fields KYC allows participants to engage properly, unfortunately there was a rush and they decided not to pay outside of the 14 days.  I'm conducting an ongoing campaign for payment of the outstanding tokens to people who helped publicise the ICO : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2892870.msg29743762#msg29743762 Please register how many tokens you were due and as much information as possible.   The current stance of the company is to ignore the community complaints which just says to me we have not organised enough of a response to this failure to pay.   Heres a blog written by the COO https://medium.com/@HEROCoin/why-we-had-supporters-actually-claim-their-bounties-8e065517439a   If you agree with that blog say so, if you disagree then you better speak up or you cant blame the company for not being bothered about your lost tokens.    The basic response to that there is no democratic country fields a law that presumes criminality.  If HEROcoin meant to comply with a law of KYC or regulator then it still leaves those tokens as due, to remove payments owed on a presumption of guilt or failed KYC is not correct.    Every company in crypto fields open KYC allowing people to pass when possible.     I'm interested to hear of any company excusing itself from payments citing KYC as a reason why.   The tokens are due and the debt is outstanding.  Quote from: karlu92 on March 12, 2018, 10:42:06 AM You registered at 31. January 2018, there was no bounty after that time, so why are you asking? Of course they paid everyone who took part in the bounty and respected the rules and claimed the tokens in time! I imagine he took part in the publicity off this site, perhaps twitter or facebook.   Myself I took part in this forum but the bounty thread OP or title was not updated, the campaign manager did not mention KYC would be required to anyone, the spreadsheet was not updated with new KYC requirements and the thread was not updated in the days before the deadline.

Body: Exchanges measure volume in BTC usually as its related to general tide of interest that comes in line with BTC price I think.   I dont know if theres any target but generally anything over 1 btc daily is reasonable long term for something not yet in operation? Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: They dont respond to emails since November.    Lodge your details on the thread I have started for reputation of HEROCoin.    KYC also means paying what is owed eventually not that it is forgotten and we the members of Bitcointalk will make sure that happens for the ongoing allocated tokens for publicity that is so far ignored. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2892870.msg29743762#msg29743762  I've seen this attitude plenty times before with companies vs indivuals, I dont give up just like that, I'm not that weak or appreciate being judged that way.  I want anyone in a similar position to just help us construct a reasonable argument to proceed with and post as many details as possible please.  http://www.ibtimes.com/cryptocurrency-icos-must-stop-flying-blind-money-laundering-risks-2631057 Heres an article on KYC which is the reasoning by the company for not paying what it owes.   They are misusing this as a reason to NEVER pay which is not correct, I'm happy if anyone can post evidence to support such a stance.    Individuals must unite to correct his mistake, I'll also be starting a petition regarding the KYC so post your opinion on that also.    I do hope this company is successful and I wont give up because I'm involved in Counter strike and esports for the best part of 20 years now and that is why I took an interest in HEROCoin to begin with; but to ignore people on KYC is a mistake I'm fairly sure and there is evidence more then a few people did not have a chance to receive payment after being promised payments would be sent.   Its very possible for this token or value to be paid legally and I want nothing else

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Its not FUD.   The ICO campaign was due to pay out tokens to participants but failed to pay citing KYC regulations in Austria as the reason.   There was no warning before taking part it was decided retrospectively.    This is why some view it as dishonest practise, thats a reasonable point of view when the value could have gone towards Bitcointalk forum costs from which the campaign benefited.   For the tokens to just disappear without payment is why HEROcoin  is viewed badly by some  On the other hand the HEROcoin (PLAY) believes they have to abide by possible regulatory oversight and KYC was part of that.   That also was reasonable, heres some context of the fear the company might have had: Quote Quote   https://politiken.dk/forbrugogliv/digitalt/art6328177/Teleselskaber-får-besked-på-at-lukke-for-skinbetting-sider    Those tokens should not have disappeared on account of changes to terms after the ICO had closed.   It was reasonable for this forum itself to be repaid for its help with the ICO, Ive asked months ago that charities benefit if I'm excluded as not a valid individual.      To allow only 14 days and tell me after I had a month,  even the COO was confused how long we actually had, to pass this previously unknown hurdle seems to be an unfortunate rush that occurred to launch.   I can understand some of it because I've bet on CSGO games for years so I get some context the company wants to continue long term within legal boundaries but its not reasonable to disregard participants as some kind of potential criminal.     I asked where is the best place to start a forum thread on this issue, reputation section seems most applicable.  I've started a thread on missing Tokens, I will edit and update the Opening post and Thread title, which was part of what the HEROcoin ICO failed to do with its participants on this forum.  Heres the link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2892870.msg29743772#msg29743772

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: I dont think it is a scam, I'm pretty sure I chose well when I took the risk of being paid in these tokens.   Its a legit business with decent prospects, otherwise it would be a worthless token to be paid in and a waste of time from the beginning.  It is ironic that it is part of a strict adherence to KYC that caused this failure to payout the allocated bounties and that has led to the perception of deceptive bounty terms.     Its a mixup over KYC legislation and that became a requirement introduced retrospectively after the bounty had closed.   Its a reasonable requirement for any company to proceed lawfully but I've never heard of KYC being used to forfeit in only 14 days in any other case.  I was told we had a month to pass KYC but it started a week into November and closed a week before end of the month so it was about 14 days total, I think there was a rush hence why I say some mixups occurred.    I suggested that if identity cannot be legally proved then participants could nominate a charity like Red Cross or a Cancer research charity for their allocated tokens.   That should be possible and it seems a reasonable outcome to me. I myself can pass KYC on any online site that requires it, I have an available credit record usually thats the drawback but even with other betting firms its a driving license thats required or similar, I'm sure it should be possible for most people to do.  I do suggest being reasonable not slinging mud, alot of the time you deal with people in a company who are just doing what they are told.   The overall KYC legislation itself was just a requirement the company had to follow, we didnt know it'd be such a problem at the campaign start and neither did the company apparently.   I will start a thread, I'll ask around what is the best forum section to proceed with; but we'll collect details of everyone who did not pass KYC and their intentions for the missing allocated tokens from the various campaigns held during the ICO.

Body: Sounds like a normal market flush out to me.  The balance of supply and demand for those tokens tipped towards supply because of the bounty participants selling or not being able to hold because of low capital overall available to invest.  But elsewhere you have genuine demand for this kind of product, so long as the underlying business is seen as valid the excess supply gets bought up.   The price is secondary to that shift back and forth I think, like a set of scales is how I image the strength balance in most market prices.

In the best hope of communicating properly now I would also suggest its best not to assume any of this was malicious.

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: If the payment is to be made in PLAY tokens then its probably not beneficial for anyone to label it negatively, so long as people are human then mistakes can be made and hopefully corrected.  As its a consumer facing company I'd hope that is an ongoing possibility.   Theres more then a few people Im trying to gather together who were not able to get a claim in.  A couple I think have english as a second language and have been disadvantaged in submitting details and Im happy to collate information required for everyone, I'll work through any details that are missing to fill in the gap between the company and its bounty campaign participants.   Its better to just reduce the reasons for not paying then building them up with accusations I think.   Its a failure in communication to participants, even this thread keeps the same title with nothing on the opening post to show a new deadline added. Quote Quote I found the comment I missed within the Signature bounty thread 177 pages of comments, a line of text can be missed unfortunately.  The title and starting information asks people to check spreadsheet details are correct, no new requirement was added to OP or title or the spreadsheet itself to indicate no payment would be made.  Had I also done the twitter or facebook campaigns I found those avenues more clearly done but Bitcointalk itself is a forum where most of us were initially contacted, I dont especially use other platforms outside of forums not everyone does.   I did register on https://www.herosphere.gg/ at the start of October and my email address is available there but I dont think any related news appeared to alert people to report in for a change of terms.     The change to terms after payment had been promised caused some to miss the new details required, if anything is missing it would be best if the claimants contacted me or add your details to an open spreadsheet so we can get clear contact information together.   The standard way of using a forum is to alter the opening post and also alter the thread title if possible.   Even start a new thread with the new terms required would take only a few minutes and if its going to be causing losses to people involved  its worth doing.

Author: STT
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: I have been in communication about payment as per the original terms of the campaign since November and no settlement has been reached yet.  I will be representing a few of the people who were not paid due to changes after the campaign closed which were not communicated to participants.   I'm happy for bitok50 to get in contact with details so we as a group achieve some settlement of the original amounts owed.    The explanation I've received so far is that it was impossible to communicate, I have replied that it was as simple as a thread title change to alert participants to new terms required but no attempt to notify the campaign manager was made and information was not provided hence the failure to pay.  I have not yet received a reply to that, no doubt they are busy and I wish them every success and I'm sure the project is addressing a very valid growing market sector.  I'm confident as a group we will be able to achieve some compromise to resolve the matter to the satisfaction of all.

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: First listing will be on 20th December. There are still some negotiations but we should get an update about which exchange it will be very soon. It's not officially listed on ED and the volume is pretty low there so I personally do not think that the price is representative. Some people sell their bounties at the moment to get quick bucks, don't expect such a low price on official exchanges but we will see. The first "use case" of HERO will be on HERO's own platform (herosphere.gg.) and fully integrations happen until Q2 2018. Around the same time, there should be the API for 3rd parties available. Demand should rise at this point latest. There are several marketing campaigns planned to make the platform more popular, also there is already a strong userbase (250k users) on herosphere.gg  Hope this answers your questions properly. If there is anything more don't hesitate to ask

Author: codemanX
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: I disagree too, to go to an exchange right after the ICO is just good for ICO flippers, bounty hunters and speculators, but not for investors. I have no problem with giving the team some time to build up a high quality platform and doing their legal things because development needs time, why only a few people are understanding this.

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: I disagree too, to go to an exchange right after the ICO is just good for ICO flippers, bounty hunters and speculators, but not for investors. I have no problem with giving the team some time to build up a high quality platform and doing their legal things because development needs time, why only a few people are understanding this. [/quote]  Well I understand that some people are impatient. Until now there was hardly any project facing the legal stuff the way HERO does, it is a new approach to the Crypto World. I think as soon more and more companies have to work like that people get used to this process. If you take a look at CMC there is everyday a project which explodes and reach 5x or 10x returns so they wish that result for their own tokens - unfortunately only a few achieve such gains and more important can hold the value over a longer period.  However, I think HERO is doing it right. One step after another. They always claimed to be a long term project - and long term means more than 6 month I think we have a bright future here with this token but one need to be patient :-)

Body: Could you please clarify because this is what I read in their WP.  "The HERO is designed as a decentralized ERC20 token on the Ethereum blockchain allo- wing for the exchange and interchange of a point-based pooling system with the purpose of betting on future events like major (e)sport matches or public engagements."

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: As already mentioned above there is a second project with the same name. They also claimed to use the same ticker name for the Token. To avoid mixing up those two Tokens, HERO decided to rename the Token from HERO to PLAY. The company, however, is still named HERO.  HEROcoin (which use PLAY) creates a betting ecosystem, implemented first on their own platform - herosphere.gg -and provides an API to 3rd parties who are interested to join the ecosystem (basically every betting provider can use the HERO ecosystem and with it PLAY). It is based in Vienna, Austria.  Hero Token - is the second project, using Hero as ticker name and is a financial project based in Asia. They are in no way related to each other. Unfortunately, this whole thing is a little bit confusing since they appeared at a similar point in time.  I hope I could clear things up a little bit.

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Actually, herosphere.gg is the own platform of HERO. They are working on it since 2014 and decided this year to take it to the next level and use the blockchain for the betting process.  They just announced the partnering with https://abiosgaming.com/ a data provider specialized on e-sports. Body: Quote from: strelok25 on September 23, 2017, 11:22:41 PM Quote from: Sergei.Gerasimenko on September 23, 2017, 05:54:13 AM You have few hours to change signatures before I start to update spreadsheets. Please quote this message.  Hi Dev, I ask you to charge me tokens on a signature company 100% in full over the past week as I fulfilled all the conditions of the signature company. It's not my fault that you change the signatures at the end of the week when there is already a calculation of the rates especially about the changes in the signature you should have written on the main page of the company's bounty since the participants do not read all the pages with reports on the bounty it's not good for them. the rules with the signatures should come into force from the next week after September 23rd-September 29th, and then count the shares according to the new rules and not for the last week. This is unfair when you do not pay 100% for the work already done. Thank you for understanding  Signature updated. I hope you fix the amount of my tokens for 16.09-22.09 a week as the rules for new signatures were announced after 22.09 date and these rules should not apply to last week 16.09-22.09 this is logical. Thank you for your understanding.

Author: bon3s90
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: As a user of herosphere.gg you will use your HERO Tokens as a wager. Means there are no additional fees to pay. byte heroes as a provider of contests will get their "reward" out of the betting pool like you as a Token holder. An example is given in the Whitepaper: Betting pool 100 HERO -> at least 1% of that will be distributed among all Token Holders according to their percentage of holdings So in this case 1 Token.  The Hero coins of the developers will be locked a certain time, anyway they will not dump it since they want to develop the system!

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Hi unsoindovo, we went for a different model than other ICOs here: We thought it's fair for you guys to have a fixed reward for a fixed action and this is how we've done it: The bounties are taken from the marketing pool and do not decrease the amount offered at the token sale.  This has three advantages: 1) You get a fixed reward for anything you do which does not decrease, if more people take part. 2) We hope to reduce scamming attempts by it, since bounty participants do not indirectly compete against each other. 3) More transparency. We love transparency.  Let's see how it works out

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: As soon as we put the contest templates public, everyone should be able to create games.  For example:  You want to create a game with your friends, the contest template allows you to create a game and set the reward for the work of creating a new game. This will be a percentage of the pot which is played over your games. There is a minimum of 1 % that all HERO holder receive, the creator reward is flexible.  So if you don´t want to charge your friends anything for setting up a game you can leave the creator reward at 0%. If you set it too high, probably not all of your friends will want to join the game and you also receive less.  The creator reward is flexible in order to allow individuals and existing business models to be adapted, as not every model needs the same percentage of a reward to run their games and it allows existing providers to onboard the HERO system.

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Some bonus levels are driving markets down after the ICO as people are taking their profits, right now there are unrealistic bonus structures in the crypto world, we are seeing 70-100% bonuses on ICOs. Our main goal is to create a healthy environment. No bonus = no reason to dump under ICO price and only upwards potential afterwards.  The 600.000.000 token sale has been answered several times in this thread, we aim to create a longterm business here and need this structure for:  - onboarding 3rd parties - longterm business development - betting reserve - esports fund - creation of a healthy market by issuing over time to more people ...etc

Author: fruor
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Join our Telegram channel|Read the WHITE PAPER   The HERO ecosystem consists of game creators and players. Everyone is able to participate by simply joining or creating games. The whole community benefits from a growing activity as every HERO token holder is ensured to receive a rake back of all played games. Additionally, those who take the effort to create games receive a creators reward.    Token Holder All token holders are guaranteed a reward out of all distributed prize pools. Player Game winners receive their respective part of the prize pool. Game Creator Game creators are rewarded for their effort to create and manage games.   Contest variety - Templates   The development team of HERO coin aims to create free accessibility and constantly growing set of smart contracts, each representing a different form of the game. A game creator can use the contract which fits his needs best, to offer betting with the HERO cryptocurrency. All of these smart contracts have one interface in common which guarantees that each contract implements basic characteristics of the HERO economy like the community-reward. The fact that these smart contracts are deployed during game creation, makes them exchangeable and allow for future enhancements of game mechanics.     The online betting industry has suffered from a lack of innovation for years and the conditions for players worsened over time.  Unfair conditions Odds are created by experts based on tons of exclusive data undisclosed to the public. Lacking Transparency and Trust Centralized authorities control the payouts resulting in lacking transparency of the money flow. No Social Dynamics Social dynamics are lost as interfering middleman prevent direct peer to peer interaction.      HERO radically changes todays centralized way of online betting. The token enables you to join or create games on the ethereum blockchain. The design of HERO enforces active and passive income streams for all participants in the ecosystem. This transparent and decentralized way of betting breaks the traditional "the house always wins" paradigm.    The mission of HERO is as simple as it is powerful: establishing a new level of trust, transparency, and security, yet unknown in the world of online betting     HERO is intended to suite not only the community but also existing betting providers. Our public API enables to connect to the HERO network to run games with different contest templates, even centralized betting providers can use HERO as their first step towards a more transparent and decentralized future. The whole ecosystem is designed to not only bring in a variety of games but also an organic growth through new game creators, influencers, and other participants marketing their games to existing and emerging communities.   More than just an idea - A Finished Product  Most of the ICOs and tokens just sell ideas. HERO is different. HERO emerged from a real world need of the esports betting platform, herosphere.gg. Already entertaining more than 200.000 users, herosphere will be the first provider to implement the HERO token. Others have mere ideas, we build solutions.      Coming from esports  At herosphere.gg we love gaming. Our team consists of (e)sports enthusiasts, therefore we developed an innovative betting platform for esports events. Esport is a rapidly growing market. The number of esport enthusiasts is anticipated to continue growing by a CAGR of over 10 percent for the next years. In 2014, the number of esports enthusiasts was on the same level as ice hockey, for 2018 it is anticipated that esports will overtake American Football. The global esports market generated more than USD 460 million in revenue in 2016, and is anticipated by Newzoo to grow to USD 1.1 billion by 2019. Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: We will implement the HERO token on our platform herosphere.gg in Q4/2017 so you will be able to play already (not fully decentralized yet), but we will provide contest templates from Q1/2018 on, so everyone will be able to create games on the network. These contest templates will be developed throughout 2018 so different types of games can be displayed.  The provider or game creator reward can be set by the creator themselves in order fit to different business models of existing providers and new projects being build on top of HERO.

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: Yes, If you have multiple (re-)tweets to submit, you have to submit them individually.  We want to make sure everyone receives their fair amount for the Bounties, this is the safest way to track it for us.

Author: herocoin.io
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: 600Million are for the ICO. We have laid that out in the Whitepaper: We will use some of it for financing the further development of the smart contracts that work with HERO (one of the main points of HERO is it's adaptability for any game model), some of it will be used for supporting esports tournaments and teams (which on the other hand offers usage scenarios for HERO again, which the coin will benefit from) and we will also use it to support third parties to integrate the coin into their systems, so they can easily make their systems as transparent, secure and easy to use as it is our aim with HERO.  This was actually something the community asked us to do, because some (mainly smaller) ICOs gave away a large part of their coins. This left them with little motivation to generate sustainable growth for the coin, but also - and worse - with little possibilities to act in a way that sustains growth. Definitely something, one would not want after investing in a coin

Author: Earn with Bitcoin
Title: [MAINNET] 💪 HEROcoin (PLAY) | 🔥 Decentralized Solution for Online Betting 🔥
Body: An interesting ICO - I like that you have all the profiles of the involved people listed, including LinkedIn. Such transparency is rare, and a nice change to some of the shadier ICO's on this board. Also, the fact that there is an existing product is a positive signal, this might help the product to stand out in a relatively crowded niche. Let's see how it goes, will be watching...
